text: Johann Gottfried Galle (9 June 1812 in Radis, Saxony-Anhaltâ€“10 July 1910 in Potsdam, Brandenburg) was a German astronomer at the Berlin Observatory who, with the help of student Heinrich Louis d'Arrest, was the first person to view the planet Neptune, and know what he was looking at. He used the calculations of Urbain Le Verrier to know where to look. Category:1812 births Category:1910 deaths Category:German astronomers Category:Scientists from Saxony-Anhalt
title: Johann Gottfried Galle
